issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: When going from the pending state to the running state, after starting the instance, the IP information won't get refreshed, displaying empty fields. On the other case, when stopping the instance, going from 'stopping' to 'stopped' does not clear out the IP information, either.
fields.summary: On instance detail page, the IP information doesn't get updated after going from pending to running, or stopping to stopped.

comments.body: can combine with state to just do one call.

[~kgill] [~jloza] As working on the solution to dynamically modify the DNS name and IP display, it was discovered that there exists different behavior between Eucalyptus and AWS. Eucalyptus assigns the IP and the DNS name once the instance goes to the state "Pending, however on AWS, the IP and DNS is not given until the instance goes to running.

This means that once the instance changes the state, either going from 'pending' to 'running', or 'stopping' to 'stopped', some manual DOM manipulation needs to take place in order to properly display the correct list of available IPs and the options for the Public IP address selection, which is never the favorable solution since it tends to get messy -- a sample work can be found in the branch GUI-552, which took care of the 'stopping' to 'stopped' case until the issue with 'pening' was discovered on AWS.

One suggestion solution in this case is that simply to refresh the page once the instance goes from 'pending' to 'running', or 'stopping' to 'stopped'. In such case, all the information displayed on the detail page will be accurate, and the page will be able to maintain the clean states for all options and element.

Please share your thoughts on this approach.

[~jloza] We found during initial user testing that modifying the instance state in a drop-down isn't intuitive, so we moved the state change operations to the actions menu on the instance detail page.  We should IMO do the same for the IP operations.  Moving the assign and un-assign operations to a dialog would solve this ticket and offer a better UX.  Thoughts?  /cc [~kyolee]

In more details with this issue, the instance view page's public IP select dropdown options are configured from the server via the choice manager prior to the page load, which handles a fair amount of logic based on the state of the instance. However, the issue is that since this state of the instance is to be altered on the client-side, i.e. going from 'pending' to 'running', the options for the public IP select dropdown on the browser also needs to be adjusted, which means introducing the dropdown option condition logic on to the client-side via javascript, which makes both the JS script and the template messy.

So, there are 3 ways to go about this issue -- one is to go with the solution to hack away the existing dropdown options via javascript, the second is to refresh the page once it detects the instance state has been updated, and the last is to move the public IP selection operation to a stand-alone dialog as suggest above.
FYI, the current solution in the GIT branch GUI-552 works as it is for Eucalyptus; it's AWS's different IP assignment timing causing more complication.

[~kgill], [~kyolee]: We could provide this as a dialog if that helps, by all means. We had it in a dialog in 3.4.x. You can use the attach/detach volume to instance pages as guidelines for how this should look and behave, I would think, and refer back to the old wireframes at https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Associate+Address+with+Instance and https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Disassociate+Address+from+Instance

and of course just ping me with any questions if you are unsure about anything. Thanks!

[~jloza] [~kgill] The issue with this new dialog approach is that we are not clear on how to handle the case where the user wants to assign the IP as starting up the stopped instance. In the current setup, as the IP is updated on the stopped instance, a dialog pops up and asks user if the instance should be started.

[~kyolee] in 3.4.x we don't allow users to access the dialog to associate IPs with stopped instances. 

The IP is assigned automatically as the instance starts up. (I assume the cloud handles maintaining the same EIP for the instance when it's stopped? Not sure, that is all handled by the cloud I believe so it's out of my jurisdiction). We should maintain that same behavior for 4.0.
Awesome. Then, we will only allow the associate IP feature for running instances. That will make things much simpler.

* associate: button text should match the button text that is displayed when this dialog is launched form the IP side of the world, please.
* disassociate: Dialog should match entirely the dialog that is launched from the IP address side of the world, please, although in both dialogs you need to fix whatever is causing the sentence with the two variables in it (the "are you sure..." sentence) to break into two lines, it should all be one sentence. You can use the detach volume dialog as a model if you need one.
IP information is updated, but the text fix requested in this bug was not fixed. Will file other bug for that.
